com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.lambdainvoker

Class LambdaInvokerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.lambdainvoker.LambdaInvokerFactory

  • public class LambdaInvokerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class that creates a dynamic proxy object backed by Lambda service.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  LambdaInvokerFactory.Builder
      Builder class for LambdaInvokerFactory

    • Constructor Detail

      • LambdaInvokerFactory

        public LambdaInvokerFactory(android.content.Context context,
                            Regions region,
                            AWSCredentialsProvider provider)
        Deprecated. Please use LambdaInvokerFactory.builder() .context(context) .region(Regions.AP_NORTHEAST_1) .credentialsProvider(provider) .build();
        Constructs a Lambda invoker factory object.
        Parameters:
        context - context of the app. A client context will be created from the given context.
        region - region of Lambda service
        provider - a AWS credentials provider

      • LambdaInvokerFactory

        public LambdaInvokerFactory(android.content.Context context,
                            Regions region,
                            AWSCredentialsProvider provider,
                            ClientConfiguration clientConfiguration)
        Deprecated. Please use LambdaInvokerFactory.builder() .context(context) .region(Regions.AP_NORTHEAST_1) .credentialsProvider(provider) .clientConfiguration(clientConfig) .build();
        Constructs a Lambda invoker factory object. If your Lambda function takes a long time to finish (longer than the default socket timeout of 15 seconds), you can increase the timeout via ClientConfiguration . 
         ClientConfiguration config = new ClientConfiguration();
 config.setSocketTimeout(5 * 60 * 1000); // 5 minutes
 LambdaInvokerFactory factory = new LambdaInvokerFactory(context, region,
         provider, config);
        Parameters:
        context - context of the app. A client context will be created from the given context.
        region - region of Lambda service
        provider - a AWS credentials provider
        clientConfiguration - client configuration for the factory

        public static LambdaInvokerFactory.Builder builder()
        Some examples: LambdaInvokerFactory.builder() .context(context) .region(Regions.AP_NORTHEAST_1) .clientConfiguration(clientConfig) // Optional .credentialsProvider(provider) .build(); LambdaInvokerFactory.builder() .context(context) .awsConfiguration(awsConfig) .clientConfiguration(clientConfig) // Optional .credentialsProvider(provider) .build; LambdaInvokerFactory.builder() .lambdaClient(client) .clientContext(clientContext) .build;
        Returns:
        builder

      • build

        public <T> T build(java.lang.Class<T> interfaceClass)
        Contexts a dynamic proxy object of the given class with a default Json data binder.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type for the class
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - the class to be dynamically proxied by Lambda
        Returns:
        a dynamic proxy object of the given class

      • build

        public <T> T build(java.lang.Class<T> interfaceClass,
                   LambdaDataBinder binder)
        Contexts a dynamic proxy object of the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the interfaceclass.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - the class to be dynamically proxied by Lambda
        binder - a data binder to convert between POJO and byte stream.
        Returns:
        a dynamic proxy object of the given class

      • getClientContext

        public ClientContext getClientContext()
        Gets the client context associated with this factory. Changes to the client context will affect all proxy objects created by this factory, including those were created.
        Returns:
        client context
